metadata.Title: CVE-2016-6627 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in phpMyAdmin. An attacker can determine the phpMyAdmin host location through the file url.php. All 4.6.x versions (prior to 4.6.4), 4.4.x versions (prior to 4.4.15.8), and 4.0.x versions (prior to 4.0.10.17) are affected.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-6627` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

phpmyadmin - 4:4.6.4+dfsg1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: phpmyadmin package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4:4.6.4+dfsg1-1').
